Title: Implement batch scoring feature
Body: Extend Flask backend to handle multiple image uploads. Create a `/batch_upload` route returning a table of predictions for each image.

Title: Design batch prediction table in dashboard
Body: Add a new tab in **dashboard.html** displaying filename, probability, and decision. Allow CSV export of batch results.

Title: Integrate DICOM file handling
Body: Add optional DICOM support using **pydicom**. Convert `.dcm` files to arrays for model inference while preserving metadata.

Title: Add DICOM upload toggle in UI
Body: Update sidebar controls to include 'DICOM mode' checkbox. Adjust upload logic to accept `.dcm` files.

Title: Run bias and slice analysis
Body: Conduct exploratory bias checks by patient age/sex or acquisition site (if metadata available). Visualize group performance metrics.

Title: Generate bias and limitations report
Body: Create **docs/bias_limitations.md** summarizing bias analysis results and key ethical considerations.

Title: Optimize model inference speed
Body: Profile inference time per image. Experiment with model quantization or GPU acceleration where possible.

Title: Containerize Flask app with Docker
Body: Write a **Dockerfile** and `.dockerignore`. Include environment setup, model loading, and port exposure for deployment.

Title: Deploy app to Render or Railway
Body: Deploy containerized Flask app to chosen cloud platform. Validate routes and Grad-CAM overlay generation post-deployment.

Title: Add GitHub Actions CI/CD pipeline
Body: Set up `.github/workflows/ci.yml` to run tests, build Docker image, and trigger deployment on push to main.

Title: Create final project README and technical report
Body: Combine all weeks’ documentation into one polished README with performance summary, usage, and ethical disclaimers.

Title: Record short demo walkthrough
Body: Capture a 2–3 minute screen recording of dashboard inference and Grad-CAM explanations for LinkedIn/portfolio.

Title: Commit and push all Week 4 artifacts
Body: Ensure Docker, CI/CD, deployment, and bias analysis updates are committed and pushed. Tag release v1.0 on GitHub.

Title: Refactor data loading pipeline to optimize performance
Body: Revise **src/data_loader.py** to implement efficient data loading with caching and prefetching. Benchmark load times before and after changes.

Title: Integrate advanced data augmentation techniques
Body: Incorporate augmentations like CutMix and MixUp in **src/data_loader.py**. Evaluate their impact on model robustness during training.

Title: Evaluate augmented model performance
Body: Retrain model with new augmentations and compare metrics (AUC, precision, recall) against previous results. Document findings in **docs/week4_summary.md**.

Title: Implement unit tests for new features
Body: Create tests for batch upload, DICOM handling, and Docker setup in **tests/** directory. Ensure coverage with pytest.
